09:04 <vmassol> acotiuga: hi  
09:05 <vmassol> I wanted to fix the URL for https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XINFRA-198  
09:05 <vmassol> but I see it's already fixed but the issue is still open  
09:05 <acotiuga> I just fixed it now  
09:05 <acotiuga> hello  
09:05 <acotiuga> I can't close it  
09:06 <vmassol> k fixing permissions  
09:08 <vmassol> should be ok now  
09:08 <vmassol> (I've already closed it though)  
09:08 <acotiuga> I saw it, thanks!  
09:10 <acotiuga> Wouldn't it be great to have on l10.xwiki.org the Reload Application button on each application and not to run the whole contrib instead?  
09:11 <vmassol> this exists already :)  
09:11 <vmassol> for example: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Contrib/XPollTranslation  
09:12 <vmassol> if you're admin there's a "Import/reimport default language file" link  
09:14 <acotiuga> As a non admin user, I'm able to push the Reload Aplication Contrib, but I can't reload a translation for Xpoll Application :)  
09:14 <vmassol> ok that's probably a bug that you can do it on contrib  
09:14 <acotiuga> I can do it on the others as well  
09:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <vmassol> tmortagne: good morning, acotiuga was asking if it was normal that as a simple user he could reload the full contrib app on l10n but not see the "Import/reimport default language file" link  
09:24 <tmortagne> probably a missing if for the full application  
09:24 <vmassol> yep, since it takes a lot of time, might be better to hide it  
09:25 <tmortagne> that's why the other one is hidden yes  
09:25 <tmortagne> not really a security issue  
09:29 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <jzhang> has quit  
09:32 <tmortagne> I still have work to do on XWIKI-13157 and I will start looking at the 8.0 release (probably around noon)  
09:32 <tmortagne> in the meantime if everyone could move issue, update releae note, etc.. that would be great  
09:33 <vmassol> ok doing it for my issues in 2mn  
09:37 <vmassol> tmortagne: there's only 3 issues, 2 from you and one fro Caty  
09:37 <vmassol> \*from  
09:37 <vmassol> the one from Caty is for guillaume: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13179  
09:37 <vmassol> pretty important issue though but it could wait for 8.0.1 or 8.1 probably  
09:38 <vmassol> depends if GD has the time or not this morning  
09:38 <vmassol> would be good if he had

10:27 <vmassol> tmortagne: re XWIKI-13191 any idea why the EC could be null during extension install?  
10:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's required to install a XAR extension so not sure no, would need to debug when it was set to null  
10:29 <vmassol> ok I hope we can reproduce...  
10:37 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <pbert> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <pbert> Hi there, I'm trying to run xwiki under a different webapp-name. The webapp-name is something like "my-xwiki". I changed the xwiki.webapppath to "my-xwiki/" and also added an servlet-mapping from "/my-xwiki/\*" to the action servlet. With IE everything works fine. With Firefox the first request of a page works fine, but in all following request  (loading .css, .js files) the URL encoding is wrong. The dash between "my-xwiki" is shown as "  
10:42 <pbert> ... the resource can't be found. Someone got an idea?  
10:43 <pbert> All encodings are set to UTF-8  
10:44 <vmassol> Pbas: reminds me of something, what version of XWiki are you using?  
10:44 <vmassol> oops  
10:44 <vmassol> not Pbas, pbert :)  
10:44 <pbert> 6.2  
10:44 <vmassol> ah that"s why probably  
10:44 <vmassol> I remember fixing an issue around this  
10:44 <pbert> :-)  
10:45 <pbert> do you remember the fix? can i patch it myself on the old version, or do i have to update?  
10:45 <ujjwal> has quit  
10:47 <vmassol> ok found it  
10:47 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11401  
10:47 <vmassol> but it wasn't about a dash, it was about underscore...  
10:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <vmassol> maybe the fix would help, I don't know  
10:49 <vmassol> in any case you should try upgrading to at least 6.4.8 (or 7.4.2 if you wish to benefit from Nested Spaces)  
10:49 <pbert> hmm... thx a lot ... i will update to the latest 6.x and have look ... I'll let yozu know in some minutes ;-)  
10:50 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <vmassol> k thx  
10:52 <lambainsaan> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <pbert> wow... looks good by now! (on XWiki 6.4.8)  
11:03 <pbert> thx vincent!  
11:13 <vmassol> pbert: cool! :)

13:21 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <jzhang> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <acotiuga> I need to check in a subwiki if an user from a group exists in the main wiki (using $xwiki.exists()) and apparently I can't do it because the username does not contain the wiki id (e.g. xiwki:XWiki.Administrator)  
14:14 <acotiuga> Wouldn't it be better have the wiki id even when an user is added in a local group inside the same wiki ?  
14:19 <ClemensR> how does xwiki know the user is a global user, then?  ... I thought the 'xwiki:'-prefix should be present for global users, at least ....  
14:21 <tmortagne> acotiuga: as ClemensR suggested, if the user in the group does not have the wiki part then it cannot be from main wiki anyway  
14:21 <tmortagne> unless you are checking in main wiki itself  
14:22 <acotiuga> Well, I'm iterating the list of users from a group from the main wiki being in a subwiki and I get the users without wiki id like XWiki.Administrator and $xwiki.exists(XWiki.Administrator) is false while $xwiki.exists(xwiki:XWiki.Administrator)  
14:22 <acotiuga> What I'm trying to say is that I would need the second form  
14:22 <acotiuga> \* while $xwiki.exists(xwiki:XWiki.Administrator)  is true  
14:26 <ClemensR> ah, you got the group from the main wiki  
14:27 <tmortagne> acotiuga: set($memberReference = $services.model.resolveDocument($groupMember, $groupDocument.documentReference.wikiReference)  
14:27 <tmortagne> that will give you the complete reference of the group member no matter what  
14:27 <tmortagne> then you can use $xwiki.exist($memberReference)  
14:27 <ClemensR> actually the page author information is stored that way, i.e. by absolute path and that ... can be a problem if moving pages between wikis...  
14:28 <tmortagne> ClemensR: you mean in the history ? because the move is supposed to update author in the current version  
14:28 <ClemensR> (please ignore me, I am just unconstructively chattering around ;)  
14:29 <tmortagne> acotiuga: actually a bit simpler:  
14:29 <tmortagne> #set($memberReference = $services.model.resolveDocument($groupMember, $groupDocument.documentReference)  
14:29 <acotiuga> thanks  
14:31 <jzhang> has quit  
15:02 <jzhang> has joined #xwiki  
15:04 <jzhang> has quit  
15:07 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <avisser> I want to look at your code so much, that I broke down and installed the maven plugin for IntelliJ. You guys should feel proud.  
15:20 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
15:21 <zzeroo> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <msmeria> has quit  
15:29 <vmassol> oops sorry for the spam  
15:29 <vmassol> FTR I was moving pages from Admin.\* to XWikiOrg.Admin and the rename failed in the middle :(  
15:29 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Admin/  
15:29 <vmassol> wrong paste  
15:29 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/429488e2cd209296f6d5  
15:31 <vmassol> actually I think it has worked, even though the rename said it failed  
15:32 <vmassol> yep  
15:32 <vmassol> so the problem is that rename says it has failed if it finds errors in the logs but these errors could be not related to the rename...  
15:33 <vmassol> same issue I reported when creating subwikis  
15:33 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13182  
15:38 <vmassol> mflorea: in the search, if I wish to search for a document containing "$wiki" how do I do it? I've tried to escape the dollar with \ but it returns hits for "wiki"?  
15:39 <ClemensR> there is one in  XWikiOrg.Admin.BrokenLinks  (in xwiki/1.0 syntax, it seems)  
15:39 <vmassol> ClemensR: you succeeded in the writing a search query ?  
15:39 <ClemensR> nope, read the logs  
15:40 <vmassol> sure but I'm interested in understanding how we can search for that using our solr search :)  
15:40 <ClemensR> in the gist, I mean . it is just the next page that got renamed after the huge stck trace  
15:40 <vmassol> so yes the issue is because some renamed pages contained xwiki/1.0 syntax  
15:40 <vmassol> and links in there  
15:40 <ClemensR> via search is probaly not so easy because of the stemmer  
15:41 <ClemensR> and  tokenizer and stuff  
15:41 <vmassol> yes exactly  
15:41 <vmassol> but since we put code in wiki page it's important that we have a way to search for code stuff  
15:42 <ClemensR> seems the database search is better suited for that, e.g. http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/DatabaseSearch?text=%24wiki&space=  
15:48 <vmassol> I've created XWIKI-13207 to track this  
15:54 <vmassol> mflorea: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/WizardTest/testCreateApplication/ is not in jira as a flicker, could you check it?  
15:55 <vmassol> it's looking for I(6''VIv… and it seems we get I(6'VIv\_fwâ'  
15:56 <vmassol> actually there are some other errors which could lead to the problem  
15:56 <vmassol> Failed to create wiki component(s) for document [xwiki:WizardTest.testCreateApplication.I(6'VIv\_fwâ.WebHome]: WikiComponentException: Registering UI extensions at wiki level requires wiki administration rights  
15:59 <acotiuga> I just changed the  xwiki-commons-pom version to 7.4.2 in Meeting Application, the build succeeds when I use mvn clean install but  it fails when I use also the -Pintegration-tests with the following error:  
15:59 <acotiuga> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project application-meeting-test: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.xwiki.contrib:application-meeting-test:jar:1.5.7-SNAPSHOT: Could not transfer artifact org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-test:jar:7.4.2 from/to maven.xwikisas.com-http-externals (http://maven.xwikisas.com/externals): Not authorized, ReasonPhrase:Unauthorized.  
16:00 <mflorea> vmassol: we talked about this test in the past  
16:01 <mflorea> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20160204  
16:01 <mflorea> 16:16  
16:01 <mflorea> 16:20 <mflorea> yes, it's not a real problem. I'm using a random  string to test that you can put anything in the name of an app created  with AWM so this can break some of the XPaths we use in tests because we  don't properly escape  
16:01 <mflorea> 16:20 <mflorea> I fixed some of the XPath but there are a few remaining  
16:03 <vmassol> ok so this proves we need to fix it, since it repeats and it's a pain  
16:04 <vmassol> generally speaking we have more and more false positives and it has become a pain  
16:04 <vmassol> jobs are constantly failing nowadays because of flickers  
16:08 <vmassol> acotiuga: hi  
16:08 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-test doesn't exist  
16:08 <vmassol> it's been split into 2 submodules  
16:09 <vmassol> you have now 3 modules actually  
16:09 <vmassol> see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/182857c98f68924afcb99d1b3c39278dee698385/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-test  
16:12 <vmassol> acotiuga: ping  
16:12 <vmassol> (see above)  
16:12 <acotiuga> hi, I read it  
16:12 <acotiuga> thanks  
16:13 <vmassol> you need to ack otherwise I can't know if you've seen it  
16:13 <vmassol> :)  
16:13 <acotiuga> ACK  
16:13 <acotiuga> vmassol  
16:15 <vmassol> :)  
16:46 <ujjwal> has quit  
17:20 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
17:29 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
17:31 <Chuguniy|2> has joined #xwiki  
17:33 <Chuguniy> has quit  
17:39 <loki\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <loki\_\_> is now known as <lokeshw24>  
17:41 <lokeshw24> Hi. Is Enygma` around?  
17:42 <Enygma`> Hi lokeshw24  
17:42 <Enygma`> how can I help you?  
17:44 <lokeshw24> Hi Enygma`. I was interested in the Gsoc-16 project under you - converting existing tests.  
17:45 <Chuguniy|2> has quit  
17:45 <lokeshw24> In the previous year - Gsoc-15 my project was exactly similar to this one, except for the language/technology.  
17:46 <Enygma`> for which project?  
17:46 <Enygma`> for which organization, I mean  
17:47 <lokeshw24> Network Time Foundation. We had migrated their tests to new framework - Unity framework + written new unit tests  
17:48 <lokeshw24> It was primarily in c/c++. But I do have written test in JUnit during my job. Selenium is the thing that I've not played with, but can learn it.  
17:48 <Enygma`> sounds good  
17:49 <Enygma`> don`t worry, there`s plenty to choose from, unit tests or functional ones :)  
17:49 <vmassol> you wouldn't be interested in fixing flickering tests by any chance? :) (just kidding)  
17:50 <Enygma`> heh, that would be the BOSS level of the summer :)  
17:50 <Enygma`> you`ve mentioned that you`re employed  
17:50 <Enygma`> will you be working during the summer, besides GSoC?  
17:51 <lokeshw24> Yeah. I believe I'm good at unit tests, having worked on it in gsoc last year + I've written Junit tests during my job. So I would love to have mixture of both : unit + functional(for challenge)  
17:51 <lokeshw24> No no. I "was" working. Now I'm a student - doing my masters.  
17:51 <acotiuga> has quit  
17:51 <Enygma`> that`s good, since having both a job and doing a GSoC can be problematic  
17:52 <lokeshw24> yes ofcourse :)  
17:52 <lokeshw24> vmassol: Sorry didn't get what exactly you meant by "flickering" test. But sounded interesting.  
17:53 <vmassol> lokeshw24: don't worry I was joking  
17:53 <vmassol> we have tests that fail from time tom time and they're becoming a pain  
17:53 <cjd> is there a technica term for flickering tests ?  
17:53 <Enygma`> a.k.a. "flaky tests" :)  
17:53 <cjd> hmm  
17:54 <cjd> ok cool thanks  
17:54 <Enygma`> yes, cjd, apparently "flaky" is the "correct" word to use  
17:54 <Enygma`> lokeshw24: so I guess you`ve read the project description  
17:54 <cjd> I wrote a project proposal that says we're going to work on our flakey tests  
17:54 <Enygma`> and you can have a look over this mail thread where I`ve already replied to a student previously asking about the same project http://markmail.org/message/fk5kqvkpjjn5bldf  
17:54 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
17:54 <cjd> Hope y'all don't mind that I committed a bit of your time to that :)  
17:56 <vmassol> cjd: project proposal = research project?  
17:56 <cjd> yeah  
17:56 <vmassol> ok cool  
17:57 <lokeshw24> Enygma`: Thanks, was about to ask the same thing. Now reading the mail.  
17:57 <cjd> Seems the answer is just to eliminate all sources of randomness such as clocks and multi-core so that the jvm is running in a perfectly repeatable VM  
18:03 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:10 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:11 <ClemensR> has quit  
18:19 <vmassol> cjd: that won't fully work  
18:20 <vmassol> because there are a lot of randmoness  
18:20 <vmassol> the xwiki code itself changes  
18:20 <vmassol> and the jvm changes  
18:21 <vmassol> (for ex when moving to java8 locally lots of tests started failing because they were wrongly written - for ex the tests expected a given order for lists and this was changed)  
18:21 <cjd> you run it on a single core machine where the clock is hard-wired to the processor steps and memory access and IO is guaranteed to take a given number of processor cycles (and the processor is paused if it actually takes more)  
18:21 <vmassol> and jenkins changes too  
18:21 <cjd> then there is no source of randomness which can leak in to the machine  
18:22 <vmassol> anyway if you were able to remove randmon you'd have a portion of the tests always failing (and working on your machine)  
18:22 <vmassol> so you'd need to fix them anyway :)  
18:22 <vmassol> (a flickering tests is a wrongly written test)  
18:23 <vmassol> I prefer to address the issue by making our test fwk less subject to flickering  
18:23 <vmassol> simplelenium for example does that  
18:24 <vmassol> (http://blog.javabien.net/2014/04/15/simplelenium-writing-robust-tests-with-selenium/)  
18:24 <cjd> well... they're a little bit bullshitting there because selenium tests are not and cannot be robust but indeed there are tricks to push the limit down  
18:24 <vmassol> hey don't call my friend bulllshit :)  
18:25 <vmassol> I actually spent an hour discussing it with David and he has some good points that I've been wanting to integrate in our fwk  
18:26 <vmassol> so yes it's always about pushing the limit down  
18:26 <cjd> I don't like when you take a very unstable platform, make it less unstable and then call it stable, that's all  
18:27 <cjd> Can't find much literatire about time-deterministic vms  
18:27 <vmassol> I'm not sure I follow you. Selenium is stable  
18:28 <vmassol> (it's how you use it that can be unstable)  
18:28 <cjd> Ok maybe wrong word, selenium tests are prone to flakyness  
18:29 <vmassol> well selenium is transparent  
18:29 <vmassol> it does what the browser does  
18:29 <vmassol> simplelenium is about helping by making the writer forced to address issue of wait  
18:30 <cjd> /nod  
18:30 <vmassol> so it's an api designed to force all calls to wait on something basically  
18:30 <vmassol> same intent as our fwk  
18:30 <vmassol> execpt we should improve ours a bit  
18:42 <cjd> has quit  
18:45 <evalica> has quit  
18:47 <Enygma`> lokeshw24: I`m off for today. You can leave any questions you might have on the mailing list. Can`t wait to review your Pull Request ;)

18:56 <lokeshw24> @Enygma : Yeah, cool. Bye.
